reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adina Apartment Hotel is a lovely property. The rooms are large and comfortable. The kitchen is well-equipped. There are two nice LCD televisions and a washer/dryer.
reviews.title: Spacious Adina

reviews.text: It is in a bit out-of-the-way location and there is only one other restaurant in the neighborhood. My only other complaint is that they charged for internet service.
reviews.title: Great Apartments

likes.disliked: — Charge for WIFI and Baby Cot

reviews.title: Full apartment convenience

reviews.title: We shouldn't have stayed here at the start of our trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment itself was lovely, fitted out with full kitchen, incl d/w, w/m and t/d. We used the pool on two occasions; it was nice and clean with plenty of towels.
reviews.title: Loved Adina immensely

likes.disliked: — distance from centre but no problems as bus is very easy

reviews.title: A very nice experience of my life
reviews.text: I stayed at the Adina for 2 weeks with my family after leaving Denmark after living there for 3 years.

reviews.title: Nice hotel; but a few disappointments
reviews.text: The location makes it very easy to visit the city as the hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the nearby Nordhavn station. I also enjoyed the close proximity to the national stadium where Danish soccer champions FC Kobenhaven play home games.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Adina
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice, I stayed in a serviced apartment which had two flat screen tvs placed on the walls of the bedroom and kitchen / lounge room.

reviews.title: A Valentine's treat in a wonderful city
reviews.text: Facilities feature a nice gym and a below average pool. I wasn't a fan of the pool whilst staying there. The spa was not working and the management didn't express much concern in trying to fix it. It also runs only for 5 minutes every half hour I was told, quite pathetic for a hotel aspiring to a certain level of prestige. The pool, although indoors, felt like it was in the freezing winters of Copenhagen as it was not warmed at all and me and my friends found amazement that they were able to sustain that level of water temperature whilst the air temperature was warm from the heating.

reviews.title: Liked it but there are a few negatives to mention
reviews.text: The atmosphere is excellent from as soon as you enter the lobby with good furniture and a nice overall vibe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do yourself a favour and book the Adina immediately - everything about this place is fabulous. The staff were the most accomodating and helpful that I have experienced anywhere in the world. We did not have to ask for any directions or ideas of things to do, on arrival they immediately offered maps, suggestions to make the most of our stay, best places to eat......the list go's on.
reviews.title: Fantastic - the reviews are all right - stay there !!!

likes.liked: — large rooms with everything you need - home away from home

reviews.text: The walk back towards the centre via the walkways around the harbour are beautiful and you can walk through Kassellet (the fort) it is worth it when you see where the 'big' hotels are, near the Tivoli as the roads are very busy and I can truely imagine that the noise would be disruptive - not at the Adina - lovely and quiet ...... oh and the most amazingly comfortable beds....if I could have tucked it in my bag and brought it home I would have.
reviews.title: OK business hotel, a long walk from anywhere interesting.
Great Find
reviews.text: The supermarket on the corner sells bottles of wine from a couple of pounds - bargain - and fresh produce too - so not as expensive as everyone makes out. Eating out prices are the same as London prices.
Go to the Tivoli in the afternoon and take check out the variety of restaurants and entertainment there - only about £8 entry and £20 for unlimited rides.
reviews.title: Great Accommodation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other things to do - go to Malmo sweden for about £12 return and make sure you do the boat tour of the Copenhagen canals cost £6.
reviews.title: Mr & Mrs H on a weekend break
5 min walk to the Little Mermaid
reviews.text: This super apartment hotel is fantastically located for walking around the nicely upmarket waterfront area and within a short stroll of the Little Mermaid. Has hotel-like facilities but with the great benefit of spacious rooms,kitchen/diner/lounge and a very decent balcony. We had the top floor which looks out over the city skyline-fantastic!.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: Whilst there is a mainline railway and road beside the building there is very little noise- as in the evenings and early mornings its pretty quiet. Connections are simple and cheap from the Airport to the nearby train station and bus 26.Walk from station takes no more than10 mins (flat) Bus stops viirtually outside. Copenhagen public transport is clean and quick. Getting to city centre by bus takes 5 mins and run about every 15 mins. No problem at all.

reviews.title: A great hotel
reviews.text: There was a happy-hour from 4 -6 on Friday when we arrived (the only night its on). Areat atmosphere with city-type workers revelling after a hard week in the office. Great fun and all alcoholic drinks half price- dont miss it!

reviews.title: Good and not far off Excellent
reviews.text: The only downside was that the pool/sauna etc was being refurbished and we had no prior warning till we arrived. Shame. Would most definately stay again if back in lovely Copenhagen.
